Title: How_Multi-Manager_Platforms_Find_Strength_in_Numbers
Author: AIP Hedge Fund Team
Description: In recent years, multi-manager platforms (Multi-PMs) have completely transformed the hedge fund world. In this FAQ, we answer fundamental questions about these Multi-PMs. What are they and why are they attracting so many investors?

Title: Which_One_Is_It?_Equity_Issuance_and_Retirement
Author: Michael Mauboussin, Dan Callahan
Description: Consilient Research considers the phenomenon of companies that both issue and retire shares around the same time. This behavior may fail the central goal of capital allocation, which is to buy low and sell high. Which one is it?

Title: After_Trough_NAV_Discount_Comes_Trough_NAV
Author: Laurel Durkay, Simon Robson Brown, Christopher Freemantle
Description: Historically, the trough in European listed real estate NAV discounts has preceded the trough in values and NAVs by around six to nine months. We think this time is no different, and that now we're at--or very close to--trough NAV for the sector.

Author: Floating-Rate Loan Group
Description: Insight on loan market fundamentals and the role of floating-rate loans within portfolios.

Description: The quarter ahead and top asset allocation ideas from our investment specialists moderated by Miguel Vialba, Head of Investment Management Iberia.

Author: Emerging Markets Debt Team
Description: In-depth review of fundamentals and valuations across emerging markets debt.

Title: Roller_Coaster_Continues_as_Elections_Generate_Volatility
Author: Fixed Income
Description: June was a mixed month for fixed income. Lower US yields were supported by weaker-than-expected inflation and increased market expectations of further rate cuts.What was the impact on fixed income markets? The Broad Markets Fixed Income team explains.

Title: Municipal_Bond_Market_Monitor_-_Q2_2024
Author: Municipal Bond Group
Description: Overview of the trends and developments in the muni bond markets.

Title: Hidden_Gems:_Unearthing_the_Potential_of_Overlooked_Markets
Author: Steven Quattry
Description: Small emerging and frontier market countries have weathered crises this decade, but are implementing  reforms based on orthodox economic policies. Despite massive currency depreciations, the equity markets in many of these countries, such as Argentina and Pakistan, have generated stronger earnings per share--in dollar terms--compared to the broader MSCI EM Index. Steven Quattry explains why these countries merit a closer look.

Title: Independent_thinking
Author: William Lock
Description: While active versus passive is a well-worn debate, it needn't be an either/or decision. We would argue there's a strong case for both index investing and active management to co-exist in portfolios. While passive funds provide broad-based exposure and nimble, cheap access to tactical themes, there is still an opportunity to be selective - particularly given indices' biases. When stock prices become disconnected from fundamentals, skilled stock pickers can take advantage if they have the luxury of a longer time horizon and a lopsided multiples-powered bull run still has momentum.

Title: The_BEAT_-_July_2024
Description: Use The BEAT as your timely resource for this month's markets. Each edition gives you ideas and insights that show you how to navigate the current investment environment.

Title: Key_Themes_for_the_Second_Half_of_2024
Author: Portfolio Solutions Group
Description: The second half of 2024 will be impacted by interest rates, inflation and the U.S. presidential election, among other factors. The Portfolio Solutions Group reveals our key themes for the second half of 2024.

Title: The_BEAT_for_July_-_Our_Key_Themes_and_Top_Ideas
Author: Jim Caron
Description: Jim Caron, CIO of the Portfolio Solutions Group, shares his macro thematic views on key market drivers.

Title: A major rotation is underway in global equities
Description: The surprisingly soft US June CPI print has triggered a price surge in highly-levered and beaten-up global small-cap stocks relative to their large-cap counterparts. In our view, this move is likely not over yet. Small caps had been the biggest victims of higher interest rates. Softer inflation prints in the US, but also more signs of moderation in the global economy have fuelled market expectations for earlier central bank rate cuts.

Title: Small is beautiful again: 5 questions to ask when investing in European small caps

Description: Members of the younger generation are the future stewards of the family enterprise, so it is important to invest time and resources in cultivating their interests and skills.

Description: After weeks of growing calls from Democrats to step aside, President Joe Biden has officially dropped out of the 2024 election.

Title: The_world_canat_go_green_without_Asia
Description: In this issue: A significant global shortfall in available freshwater is projected over the coming years as demand increases. Plus the good news amid the bad news about America's declining fertility rate and why it matters, and the world can't go green without Asia.

Title: A_Look_at_the_Performance_Behind_Our_Suite_of_Dynamically_Hedged_ETFs
Description: At WisdomTree, we offer two suites of strategies: one with dynamic hedging and one without. Liqian Ren examines the performance of these Funds and discusses how dynamic hedging can reduce risk and enhance returns in international markets.

Title: The_Nikkei_Has_Room_to_Run
Description: The Japanese stock market has been in limbo since the spring. Jeff Weniger explores the factors behind Japan’s market movements, including the semiconductor industry’s challenges, currency fluctuations and the ambitious Doubling Asset-Based Income Plan.

Title: Looking_back_at_Equity_Factors_in_Q2_2024_with_WisdomTree
Description: After a strong start to the year, markets entered the second quarter weighted by increasing inflation worries. Pierre Debru reviews how equity factors behaved in the second quarter of 2024 and how investors’ portfolios were impacted as a result.

Title: Money_in_Motion:_Playing_the_Trade_with_More_Clarity:_Rate_Cuts
Description: The news of President Biden dropping out of the presidential race has created a whole new layer of uncertainty into the market backdrop. Amid this volatility, we suggest focusing on an issue with more clarity: Fed rate cuts. In the first post of the Money in Motion blog series, Kevin Flanagan discusses how investors can strategically navigate rate cuts in their fixed income portfolios using a barbell strategy.

Title: An_Efficient_Way_to_Access_India's_Growth_Story
Description: Backed by strong GDP growth and a relatively calm geopolitical environment, India has witnessed one of the best recoveries and further growth relative to other major economies since the Covid-19 crisis—and it hasn’t looked back since. Against this backdrop, Ayush Babel and Jeremy Schwartz explore how India can be accessed in a more efficient way with our India Earnings Fund.

Title: 2024_Superconvergence_Biorevolution_Series:_Premonitions_of_AlphaFold_3
Description: At WisdomTree, we work with Dr. Jamie Metzl on a strategy that we term the BioRevolution. Dr. Metzl recently a book, Superconvergence: How the Genetics, Biotech, and AI Revolutions Will Transform our Lives, Work, and World. In the third part of our BioRevolution blog series, Christopher Gannatti summarizes a few key points from the book including the evolution of AlphaFold 3.

Title: Bitcoin_Halving_and_Mining_Update:_Mid-2024_Perspective
Description: We just passed the 20th of July, 2024, and approximately 90 days have passed since the pivotal bitcoin halving event in April. While Bitcoin flirted with all-time-high price levels earlier this year, nearing $74,000, Chris Gannatti and Blake Heimann explain why recent trends might refocus investors on the longer term.

Title: A tough job awaits the new Labour government
Description:
Labour's return to power is expected to bring relative stability and growth, but their ambitious plan to boost productivity could require significant tax hikes later in the term. In the latest Cross-asset Weekly our team of economic experts analyses the situation in the UK's macroeconomics and its financial markets.
Meanwhile, the ECB remains steadfast in its policy rates and maintains strict financial conditions, with anticipated rate cuts in September. Also this week China concluded its Third Plenum to discuss economic and structural reforms.

Title: The yen rebound is slowing but not over yet
Description: The explosive rally has come to a halt for now. The gap between the dollar-yen exchange rate and interest rates differentials has narrowed, but it is not closed fully. This implies the Japanese currency has a few lengths to go, though at a more gradual pace. For this reason, we think the dollar-yen rate will stay around its current level for now, but it will probably approach 140 by the end of the year.
